Key Match Events: Dominic Fletcher's RBI double in the ninth inning gave the White Sox the lead
Gavin Sheets was intentionally walked to load the bases for Jacob Amaya, who knocked in a run with a bloop single to right
Zach DeLoach broke it open with a two-run single
Luis Robert Jr. brought home the final run with a sacrifice fly
Post-Match Reflections: Interim manager Grady Sizemore said the win showed what winning baseball looks like, with solid pitching, spectacular defense, and clutch at-bats
Miscellaneous Highlights: The White Sox salvaged the finale of the three-game series behind a 7-2 victory
The White Sox need to go 10-8 in their final 18 games to avoid tying the 1962 New York Mets for the most losses in Major League Baseball's modern era
Others: Chris Flexen allowed two runs on six hits with six strikeouts and one walk in six innings
The White Sox had a diving catch by Dominic Fletcher in right field to rob Rafael Devers of a hit in the sixth inning
Shortstop Jacob Amaya made a tremendous diving stop and throw to retire Tyler O'Neill in the sixth inning
